_header: I am afeared lo what I see
Title(s): ‘les trois vivants et les trois morts’
_description:
Four English monorhyming lines serving as the titulus to an illustration in a French prose text of ‘les trois vivants et les trois morts’ (See Glixelli (1914)
XGlixelli, Stéfan. Les cinq poèmes des Trois Morts et des Trois Vifs. Paris: Champion, 1914, pl. 1 etc.)

BLAru83.Transcription:
Ich am afert Lo whet ich seMe þinkeþ hit beþ deueles
                    þreIch wes wel fair Such scheltou beFor gods loue be wer by
                    me
BLAru83.Note:
At top of page, above miniature of three living and three dead, as
                    caption.
BLAru83.Editions:
Catalogue of Arundel Manuscripts.
         London, 1834: 23.
Gray,  Douglas. 
             “The Five Wounds of Our Lord.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 10 [208] (1963): 50-51, 82-89, 127-34, 163-8: 167.

BLYT13.Transcription:
Ich am agast me þinket i seþat ȝonder stonde deuelen
                    þre
BLYT13.Note:
At top of page, above miniature of three living and three dead, as
                    caption.
